main event: The USNS Pecos spotted an unidentified flying object that was apparently a satellite on January 31, 1961.
interesting points: The object was traveling very fast and heading 130 degrees true.
The object crossed in line with the star Vega, maintaining the same magnitude.
The report states that the object could have been an artificial satellite, but there was insufficient data to determine this.
The object could also have been a meteor, but no invasion was reported, preventing a follow-up investigation.
sighted object: unidentified flying object, possibly a satellite
